description: Inherited from Middle English scuage, from Old French escuage; in Modern English, remodelled on the Old French etymon.

entries.meaning: (historical, Middle Ages) Payment to a lord in lieu of military service.
examples: […]  subsidies were not to be granted, nor levied in this case ; that is, for wars of Scotland : for that the law had provided another course, by service of escuage, for those journeys  […]
